columns.description: Police ProQA case number.
The amount of time (in seconds) between the time ProQA told the call-taker to send the incident to a dispatcher, and the time the call-taker did that in CAD
Incident Phone Pickup Time Stamp.
Incident first Unit Assigned Time Stamp
The amount of time (in seconds) it took the call-taker to process the call, from start, to the time it entered a dispatcher’s pending queue.
Incident Call Entered Queue Time Stamp.
The time at which the call-taker opened ProQA.
The amount of time (in seconds) it took the call-taker to decide between police, fire or medical ProQA and open the program.
Fire ProQA case number.
Medical ProQA case number.
The text describing the incident like life threatening emergency, nonlife threat emergency, investigation, etc.

The incident ID that uniquely identifies the parent incident associated with the multi-agency incident. The value is taken from the Master_Incident_Number column in the Response Master Incident table.
The number that uniquely identifies the incident associated with the activity. The value is system generated.
Longitude in millionths of degrees associated for the location associated with the incident.
Latitude in millionths of degrees associated for the location associated with the incident.
The time at which the call-taker finishes the call-taking process in ProQA.
The time at which the call-taker was able to send an incident to a dispatcher.
Incident ProQA determinate

Nonprofit voluntary organizations that weigh in on city matters, but exist separately from the city government and follow different rules. Each neighborhood council has defined its own border which, in some cases, are not in agreement with other contiguous neighborhood boundaries resulting in areas of overlap within the layer. The City of Cincinnati does not intervene or mediate on these boundary discrepancies.
The text describing the call disposition like Call Complete/Pt Transported, Cancel Prior to Dispatch, Cancel Prior to Dispatch, etc.
The problem that is associated with the secondary response spawned.
The number that identifies the incident associated with the secondary response spawned.
Incident response area reference.
The description of the problem like Abdominal Pain/Problems, Vehicle Fire, Crowd Control, etc.
The ID that uniquely identifies the incident associated with the record. The value is taken from the ID column in the Response Master Incident table.
An auto-generated numeric identifier for an Incident Record.
Incident First Unit Arrived At Scene Time Stamp.
Determines which ProQA was used for the incident
– Determines whether the secondary response spawned was a CFD Response.
The number of officers involved in the incident
The text description of the corresponding problem code (Incident_Type_Id).
The Unique_Report_ID is the Unique identifier for the dataset.
The number of subjects (citizens) involved in the incident
The listed neighborhood of the incident using community council defined boundaries. This attribute may differ from the SNA neighborhood depending on the location of the incident.
The listed neighborhood of the incident using the Statistical Neighborhood Approximations (SNA). This neighborhood classification is the underlying reporting area for all City data.
The CFS number is the CAD incident number related to the incident

The longitude coordinates of the incident. This attribute has been randomly skewed to represent values within the same block area (but not the exact location) of the incidents. This is done in compliance with privacy laws to protect the recipients of public safety responses.

The latitude coordinates of the incident. This attribute has been randomly skewed to represent values within the same block area (but not the exact location) of the incidents. This is done in compliance with privacy laws to protect the recipients of public safety responses.
The date and time the incident occurred

columns.description: The report number of the incident in CPD's Record Management System (RMS)

The longitude coordinates of the incident. This attribute has been randomly skewed to represent values within the same block area (but not the exact location) of the incidents. This is done in compliance with privacy laws to protect the recipients of CPD responses.
The date the incident occurred.
Day of the week in which the incident took place.
Classification of the assault on the officer
The race of the Officer (victim) involved in the incident.
The sex of the Officer(victim) involved in the incident
The listed neighborhood of the incident using the Statistical Neighborhood Approximations (SNA). This neighborhood classification is the underlying reporting area for all City data.

name: City of Cincinnati - Residential Tax Abatements (Current)
